snippet: The trial in Paris of Pascal Simbikangwa is seen as an important effort by France to end its protection of Hutu fugitives accused of participating in the genocide against Tutsis.
lead_paragraph: The trial in Paris of Pascal Simbikangwa is seen as an important effort by France to end its protection of Hutu fugitives accused of participating in the genocide against Tutsis.

headline.main: Former Rwandan Intelligence Chief Goes on Trial for 1994 Genocide

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
